quote.text: Instead of acting on impulse, take a step backâ€”wait till the enchantment fades and you can see things as they are.
quote.author: Epictetus
quote.aiInsight:
• Parenthood
    • Exercise patience: When emotions run high, take a step back to truly see the situation, fostering a calm, reflective environment for both parent and child.
    • Model mindfulness: By resisting impulsive reactions, you demonstrate to your children the virtue of thoughtful decision-making and self-control.
  • Leadership
    • Lead with composure: A true leader waits for clarity before acting, ensuring decisions are measured and informed, not driven by fleeting impulses.
    • Foster a culture of reflection: Encourage your team to pause, assess, and discuss challenges openly, turning initial impressions into well-considered strategies.
  • Product Management
    • Balance creativity with analysis: In product management, resist the urge to rush; allow ideas their moment, then evaluate them objectively once the initial excitement subsides.
    • Promote data-informed decisions: By stepping back, you give yourself and your team space to gather insights, ensuring that the path forward is both innovative and strategically grounded.
